MathNet.Numerics.Transformations.ComplexFourierTransformation Class Reference

The ComplexFourierTransformation provides algorithms for one, two and three dimensional fast fourier transformations (FFT) on complex vectors.This class caches precomputations locally, thus consider reusing/caching it. More...

 Inplace Forward Transformation in multiple dimensions. Size must be Power of Two in each dimension. The Data is expected to be ordered such that the last index changes most rapidly (in 2D this means row-by-row when indexing as [y,x]).

TransformationConvention Convention [get, set]
 Fourier Transformation Convention.

Detailed Description

The ComplexFourierTransformation provides algorithms for one, two and three dimensional fast fourier transformations (FFT) on complex vectors.

This class caches precomputations locally, thus consider reusing/caching it.

Definition at line 78 of file ComplexFourierTransformation.cs.

void MathNet.Numerics.Transformations.ComplexFourierTransformation.TransformBackward ( double[]  samplePairs,
params int[]  dimensionLengths 
)

Inplace Backward Transformation in multiple dimensions. Size must be Power of Two in each dimension. The Data is expected to be ordered such that the last index changes most rapidly (in 2D this means row-by-row when indexing as [y,x]).

Parameters:
samplePairs Complex samples (even = real, odd = imaginary). Length must be a power of two in each dimension.
dimensionLengths Sizes, must be Power of Two in each dimension

Definition at line 313 of file ComplexFourierTransformation.cs.

void MathNet.Numerics.Transformations.ComplexFourierTransformation.TransformBackward ( Complex[]  samples  ) 

Inplace Backward Transformation in one dimension. Size must be Power of Two.

Parameters:
samples Complex samples. Length must be a power of two.

This method provides a simple shortcut if your data is already available as Complex type instances. However, if not, consider using the overloaded method with double pairs instead, it requires less internal copying.
